B.  Any structure or accessory structure whose exterior surface is deteriorated, decaying, disintegrating or in poor repair must be repaired or razed. 
C.  All buckled, rotted, decayed or deteriorated walls, doors, windows, porches, floors, steps, ceilings, soffits, posts, sills and their missing members must be replaced and put in good condition. All replacement materials must match and conform to the original design or be replaced completely. 
D.  All exterior wood including pressure treated lumber or exterior unfinished surfaces, excluding those woods approved for use in their natural state, must be sealed and painted or surface-covered with other approved protective coating or treated to prevent rot and decay. All exterior walls and surfaces must be properly protected against the weather where such are defective or lack weather protection. 
E.  Any structure or accessory structure whose exterior surface is deteriorated, decaying or disintegrating shall be repaired or resurfaced. 
All exterior surfaces shall be replaced or repaired in good condition preparatory to repainting or coating. 
F.  All previously painted, stained or covered surfaces which are cracking, peeling, flaking or are in disrepair due to weathering or discoloration shall be repaired, cleaned and repainted or coated. 
(6)  Interior walls and floors. 
A.  All interior walls and floors of every structure shall be maintained free of holes and any loose or deteriorated material, as determined at the time of inspection. 
(7)  Infestation by pests. All structures and the premises thereof shall be maintained in such a manner as to discourage breeding, harborage and infestation by insects, vermin or rodents. 
(8)  Exterior property areas. Exterior property areas of all premises shall be kept free of any object, material, condition, or debris such as, but not limited to, seasonal leaves, fallen tree branches, unkempt landscaping and the lack of grass or dying grass, including the excess overgrowth of trees, bushes, shrubbery, hedges, etc., which may create a health, accident or fire hazard or which is a public nuisance or which constitutes a blighting or deteriorating influence on the neighborhood. Driveways, trees and fences shall be maintained so as not to constitute a blighting, deteriorating and/or hazardous effect in the neighborhood. 
(9)  Accessory structures. All accessory structures such as, but not limited to, sheds, barns, garages, etc., shall either be maintained in good repair and free from health, accident and fire hazards or shall be removed from the premises. 
(10)  Compost piles. Nothing in this chapter shall be so construed as to prevent persons from creating and maintaining a compost pile or piles as permitted by Health Department regulations provided such materials are not stored in quantities or locations prohibited by any other provision of this Code. All such compost materials shall: 
A.  Not be visible from the street; 
B.  Not constitute a public nuisance or nuisance to neighbors; 
C.  Not create a health or fire hazard; 
D.  Not be stored in the front or side yards; 
E.  Be stored at least five feet off the property line; 
F.  Be permitted if the compost pile or piles are enclosed by a harrier not to exceed four feet in height; 
G.  Not be in excess of one percent of the square footage of the lot or 75 feet, whichever is less; and 
H.  Not impede any natural watercourse or drainage runoff from property or any adjoining property. 
(Ord. 13-107. Passed 2-24-14.) 
1344.05 - Certificate of occupancy for new and/or repaired residential dwelling. 
(a)  No newly constructed single-family, two-family or three-family dwelling shall be occupied in whole or part unless and until the dwelling(s) has/have been inspected and approved by the Building Director or his authorized agent and a Certificate of Occupancy has been issued. The cost of the inspection herein shall be as required by Chapter 1305 and shall be included in the building permit fee. 
(b)  A single-family, two-family or three-family dwelling which has been damaged by any means so as to render the dwelling(s) uninhabitable shall not after repairs are completed, be occupied in whole or part unless and until the dwelling(s) has/have been inspected and approved by the Building Director or his authorized agent and a Certificate of Occupancy has been issued. The cost of the inspection herein shall be as required by Chapter 1305 and shall be included in the building permit fee. 
(Ord. 07-34. Passed 4-16-07.) 
1344.06 - Certificate of occupancy and zoning compliance for new and repaired commercial buildings and tenants. 
(a)  No person, firm, corporation, tenant, owner or other entity shall move into or occupy any building in the City until (except those buildings governed by 1344.05(a) and (b)) an inspection has been performed and approved by the Building Director or his authorized agent and the Fire Department and a Certificate of Occupancy and Zoning Compliance has been issued by the Building Director. NOTE: Commercial Buildings are as defined by the Ohio Building Code. The owner/tenant of such building shall apply for the inspection and said Certificate of Occupancy on applications provided by the City. 
(b)  Upon receipt of application the Building Director shall, within reasonable time, cause an inspection of such premises to be performed. Fees for Certificate of Occupancy shall be as established in Chapter 1305. 
(c)  If the Building Director determines from such inspection that the property is safe and sanitary and complies with all applicable ordinances and regulations of the City, the Building Director shall cause the Certificate of Occupancy to be issued. 
(d)  If the Building Director determines from such inspection that the property is unsafe, inadequate, unlawful and/or not in compliance with any applicable ordinance or regulation of the City, a violation notice shall be issued in writing to the applicant and corrections must be made and re-inspected prior to the issuance of Certificate of Occupancy. The fee for re-inspection shall be as established in Chapter 1305. 
(e)  Any charges, expenses and/or costs incurred by the owner/tenant in meeting the requirements of Section (d) shall in no way be the responsibility of the City. 
(f)  The Building Director hereby has the authority, upon request of the Bureau of Fire Prevention, to perform annual inspections of all commercial properties to which a Certificate of Occupancy has been issued. 
(g)  The Certificate of Occupancy and Zoning Compliance is nontransferable and becomes void upon sale of the property, expiration of lease or rental agreement and/or vacating the premises as determined by the Building Director. 
(h)  The owner, agent, or person in charge of every building shall cause to be posted conspicuously at all times at the main entrance of such structure the Certificate of Occupancy hereinbefore required. Such Certificate of Occupancy shall be provided with a protective covering and shall be securely affixed to the wall. 
(Ord. 07-34. Passed 4-16-07.) 
1344.07 - Existing structures. 
    Existing structures or portions thereof may continue to be occupied if the structure complies with the provisions of this chapter, except as to any variance heretofore or hereafter specifically granted by the City. 
(Ord. 07-34. Passed 4-16-07.) 
1344.08 - Conflict. 
    In the event of conflict between any provisions of this chapter, including any rules and regulations adopted pursuant to this chapter, and any provisions of any other ordinances of the City, including any rules and regulations adopted pursuant to such ordinances, the most restrictive provisions shall prevail, except as to provisions in the Planning and Zoning Code and as to the Building Standards for new construction. 
(Ord. 13-114. Passed 2-24-14.) 
1344.09 - Severability. 
    Sections and subsections of this chapter and the several parts and provisions thereof are hereby declared to be independent sections, subsections, parts and provisions. The holding of any such section, subsection, part or provision thereof to be unconstitutional, void or ineffective for any cause shall not affect nor render invalid any other such section, subsection, part or provision thereof. 
(Ord. 07-34. Passed 4-16-07.) 
1344.99 - Penalty; legal action. 
(a)  Whoever violates any provision of this chapter or any rule or regulation promulgated thereunder or fails to comply therewith or with any written notice or written order issued thereunder shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof be fined not less than $25.00 nor more than $1,000.00.00 for a first offense and for a second or subsequent offense shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree. Each day such violation occurs or continues shall constitute a separate offense. 
(b)  The imposition of any penalty as provided for in this chapter shall not preclude the Director of Law from instituting an appropriate action or proceeding in a court of proper jurisdiction to prevent an unlawful repair or maintenance, to restrain, correct or abate a violation, to prevent the occupancy of a building, structure or premises, or to require compliance with the provision of this chapter or other applicable laws, ordinances, rules or regulations or the orders or determinations of the Building Director, Fire Chief, the Director of Public Safety or the Board of Zoning Appeals. 
(Ord. 07-34. Passed 4-16-07.) 
Chapter 1345 - HOUSE NUMBERING[15] 

Footnotes: 
--- (15) --- 
Cross reference- Power of city to number buildings-see Ohio R.C. 715.26. Destruction of property-see GEN. OFF. 541.04. 

1345.01 - Official house numbering plat. 
    The house numbering plat heretofore prepared by the Engineer, adopted by the Planning Commission and approved by the Council by Resolution #1356 for the numbering of houses in the City, is ratified and adopted as the official house numbering plat of the City. 
(Ord. 52-39. Passed 3-4-52.) 
1345.02 - Assignment of numbers; building commissioner. 
    The Building Commissioner is directed to assign to all residences, apartments, stores, commercial buildings and all other buildings of the City a number determined from said plat, or in the event the plat does not contain the street upon which the building is erected, then he shall assign such number as shall be in accord with the general principles as set forth on said plat so that all numbers on streets shall be continuous from north to south, and east to west and so arranged that numbers on parallel streets will be in the same block and that there will be assigned, whenever possible, four consecutive numbers to each 50 feet of frontage. All numbers now in use upon a building within the City shall be deemed to be assigned in accordance with this chapter unless and until the occupant receives notice from the Building Commissioner that the number then in use is improper or incorrect, in which event the occupant shall thereafter use the corrected number assigned by the Building Commissioner in such notice. 
(Ord. 52-39. Passed 3-4-52.) 
1345.03 - Display of number. 
    Every owner, agent or occupant of any property to which a number has been assigned shall display prominently, so as to be capable of being seen from the opposite side of the abutting street, by legible digits the number assigned or reassigned under C.O. 1345.02. 
(Ord. 52-39. Passed 3-4-52.) 
1345.04 - Removal or defacement unlawful. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person to take down or deface any number put up in accordance with the provisions of this chapter or to erect or retain any number other than that provided for under this chapter after due notice of such unlawful use. 
(Ord. 52-39. Passed 3-4-52.) 
1345.05 - Change of address; fee. 
    Requests for change of address by residents shall be made to the Building Commissioner, and application shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee of $35.00. 
(Ord. 81-42. Passed 4-6-81.) 
1345.99 - Penalty. 
    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a minor misdemeanor. Each day's continued violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. 78-102. Passed 8-7-78.) 
Chapter 1349 - SWIMMING POOLS 

1349.01 - Definition. 
    A swimming pool is defined as being any water pool of over 100 square feet of water surface which is capable of containing in excess of one foot of water at its deepest point, located out of doors on private property for which there is no admission charge or membership requirement. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.02 - Permit fee. 
    No swimming pool shall hereafter be constructed unless a permit for such structure and suitable enclosure be first obtained from the Building Commissioner under the provisions of the Zoning Code. Permit fee shall be as established in Chapter 1305. Every swimming pool constructed prior to the effective date of Ordinance 57-32, passed March 4, 1957, which is enclosed with a protective barrier which, in the determination of the Building Commissioner, adequately provides for the safety of the public, shall be exempt from the specific requirements regarding barriers set forth in Section 1349.07, as long as such barrier remains. The application provided for in this section shall include a plat plan, a cross section plan of the pool and enclosure and such other data as may be required by the Building Commissioner. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.03 - Distance from property line. 
    Any swimming pool constructed after the effective date of Ordinance 57-32, passed March 4, 1957, shall be located at least five feet in distance from any property lines, and shall be to the rear of the building line as established by the Zoning Code. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.04 - Grade requirements. 
    Any swimming pool constructed or erected after the effective date of this section (Ordinance 59-36, passed May 18, 1959) shall have a normal full water line not to exceed one foot above the natural grade line of the land immediately contiguous to the pool. However, a grade differential in excess of one foot may be permitted when the Building Commissioner or the Board of Zoning Appeals, as the case may be, determines that such grade differential will not substantially increase the risk of damage to adjacent property of others by water runoff from the area enclosed within the protective barrier. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.05 - Drainage; pumping required. 
    A swimming pool constructed after the effective date of Ordinance 57-32, passed March 4, 1957, shall be so constructed that it can be drained into a storm sewer or ditch, or shall have a suitable pump for the purpose of pumping the water out of the pool to a storm sewer opening or a ditch, provided, however, that no drain line shall exceed two inches in diameter. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.06 - Illumination. 
    Swimming pools may be illuminated provided such light be suitably shaded so as to direct the light away from neighboring structures. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.07 - Protective barrier. 
    Except as provided in Section 1349.02, all swimming pools shall be surrounded by a protective barrier, which barrier shall project at least four feet in height and be no more than six feet in height above the natural grade level of the land on each side of the barrier. A house or an attached garage or a continuous wall of a detached garage may form part of the protective barrier but in no event shall a detached garage or any part of a driveway be included within the protective barrier. Gates or doors that provide access to the pool shall be locked at all times the pool is not in use by the owner or by another with the owner's consent. At least one locked gate shall be installed in the fenced portion of the protective barrier. The barrier, including gate or gates, shall have no aperture greater than 24 square inches. If the barrier is of wire it shall be of chain link construction. No barrier shall be nearer than three feet to the inside edge of the pool, A fence serving as a protective barrier under this section shall not be affected by the four-foot height limitation on fences. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.08 - Requirements not applicable. 
    The yard area requirements of the Zoning Code shall not be applicable to swimming pools. Except as such may be expressly contrary to the provisions of this chapter, all other provisions of the Zoning Code shall be applicable to swimming pools. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
1349.09 - Electrical installation. 
    The current edition of NFPA 70; the National Electric Code, Article 680 shall apply to and be enforced with all electrical installations servicing the following: 
(a)  Swimming pools. 
(b)  Hot tubs. 
(c)  Hydro massage tubs. 
(d)  Fountains. 
(e)  Any other installation where water is contained and an electrical power source is permanently connected. 
(Ord. 13-94. Passed 11-18-13.) 
1349.99 - Penalty. 
(a)  Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and fined not exceeding $50.00 for each offense. Each day's continued violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(b)  The City shall have the further right to institute injunction proceedings in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent or terminate any violation of this chapter. 
(Ord. 06-102. Passed 11-6-06.) 
Chapter 1350 - UTILITY BUILDINGS[16] 

Footnotes: 
--- (16) --- 
Cross reference- Residential accessory uses-see P. & Z. 1149.01 et seq. Permit-see BLDG. Ch. 1303. Fee-see BLDG. 1305.02. 

1350.01 - Definition. 
    Utility building means any structure used for the sole purpose of storing garden and yard equipment, toys, portable tools and home maintenance supplies and equipment usual and incidental to the use of the premises. 
(Ord. 78-78. Passed 6-12-78.) 
1350.02 - Application and permit fee; notice to abutting owners. 
(a)  No utility building shall be constructed or placed upon a lot until requirements for application and permit have been met in accordance with Chapter 1303 of the Building Standards. 
(b)  Further, it shall be the responsibility of the Building Department to notify abutting property owners that plans for such structure are on file at the Building Department for their inspection. 
(Ord. 78-78. Passed 6-12-78.) 
1350.03 - Installation and location. 
    There shall be no more than one utility building on each parcel, nor shall the utility building exceed ten feet by 12 feet on its foundation, nor exceed 12 feet in height above the natural grade. Such structure shall be installed on a firm foundation and secured to a curbing no less than four inches higher than the natural grade. Such structure shall be located in the rear yard area in accordance with Section 1149.01. 
(Ord. 78-112. Passed 8-21-78.) 
1350.99 - Penalty. 
(a)  Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a minor misdemeanor and fined not exceeding $50.00 for each offense. Each day's continued violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(b)  The City shall have the further right to institute injunction proceedings in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent or terminate any violation of this chapter. 
(Ord. 78-78. Passed 6-12-78.) 
Chapter 1351 - DETERMINATION OF GRADE LINES[17] 

Footnotes: 
--- (17) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, adopted June 19, 2017, amended Ch. 1351 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Former Ch. 1351,  1351.01-1351.99, pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Ord. No. 01-24, passed 3-5-2001; Ord. No. 16-49 ,  1, 6-27-2016. 

1351.01 - Natural grade and finished grade defined. 
    For the purposes of this chapter the following terms, phrases, words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given in this section: 
(a)  Natural grade is the elevation of the undisturbed natural surface of the ground. 
(b)  Finished grade is the elevation of the finished surface, in its slope in reference to a horizontal plane of the ground adjoining any structure. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.02 - Fee for determining grades. 
    No person shall be issued a building permit for any structure whatsoever until a $55.00 fee is paid to the Building Department or its Designee to cover costs in determining, reviewing or fixing grades. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.03 - Grade lines. 
    No building permit shall be issued until grade lines have been determined or reviewed by the Building Department or its Designee and established and indicated on the plans submitted; provided, however, no grade line permit shall be necessary nor shall a fee be charged therefor when the work called for in the application for a building permit either (i) consists entirely of interior work to an existing structure; or (ii) consists of exterior work to an existing structure or the construction of a building accessory to an existing main use when, in the opinion of the Building Department or its Designee, such work does not require the setting of a grade line different from the grade line already established. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.04 - The building department or its designee to establish grades. 
(a)  Building Department or its Designee shall be charged with the duty and final determination of natural grade lines and shall review or establish grade lines for all streets, sidewalks, boulevard, sanitary and storm sewers and structures of every kind and description. 
(b)  Prior to requesting a footer inspection and Certificate of Occupancy, the builder or owner shall request verification of the bottom of footer elevation and finished ground grade, to be certified by the City's engineer that the grade complies with the submitted plot plan. 
(c)  All grade sheet/plot plans shall be based on the natural grade found on the existing lot and shall remain consistent with the grade on adjoining lots. Finished grade at the foundation of new structures shall not be set in excess of six inches higher than the highest elevation existing at the lot lines on adjoining lots. If existing grades of adjoining lots are at different elevations, grade for subject lot will be set at the average height of the adjoining lots. Any changes to approved grade plan must be submitted for review prior to commencing construction. Exceptions will be made in extreme situations if surface run-off can be maintained on this lot and conveyed to the storm sewer or natural watercourse, without creating a nuisance per Section 1351.08. 
(d)  The required plot plans shall show natural grade elevations along property lines at 25-foot intervals, location of all structures and corresponding elevations of its foundation components, yard drain locations, swales and drainage direction lines. In the case of minor subdivisions, drainage plans, for all lots, must be submitted and reviewed prior to issuance of a building permit for any of the lots. 
(e)  Final finished grade shall comply with Sections 1351.06, 1351.07 and 1351.08. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.05 - Grade line permits. 
(a)  Permit required . A grade line permit must be obtained from the Building Department or its Designee by any person before said person or another, (i) begins construction of a new sidewalk, curb, curb-cut, driveway or driveway apron, or (ii) before any existing sidewalk, curb-cut, driveway or driveway apron is altered or repaired, where, as a result of such alteration or repair, the grade line as set by the City, or the existing grade line where no grade line has been set, will be changed. 
(b)  Application . An applicant for a permit hereunder shall file with the Building Department or its Designee an application showing: 
(1)  Name and address of the owner; 
(2)  Name and address of the party doing the work; 
(3)  Location of the work area; 
(4)  Attached plans showing details of the proposed alteration; 
(5)  Such other information as the Building Department or its Designee shall find reasonably necessary to the determination of whether a permit should be issued hereunder. 
(c)  Issuance . Such permit shall be issued upon the filing of the application required in subsection (b) above and the payment of a fee of $55.00, and the determination of the Building Department or its Designee as to the proper grade line. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.06 - Drainage of surface water. 
(a)  Whenever the surface of a lot or plot, or portion thereof, is excavated, filled, graded or hard-surfaced with impervious material, positive drainage shall be provided so that a nuisance will not be created. 
(b)  Catch basins properly connected to storm sewer or other approved provisions, such as underdrains, shall be made where water may pocket, to preclude the accumulation of surface water. 
(c)  Existing natural ground drainage of the ground area surrounding the lot or plot excavated, filled or graded shall not be impeded. 
(d)  Surface water shall not be drained onto adjacent properties. 
(e)  When a lot or section of ground is graded, it shall be incumbent upon the owner of such lot to provide that the lot is graded to the natural grade of the lots adjoining such lot, on both sides, and to the lot in the rear of such lot and, in such a manner, that surface water does not drain onto the aforesaid adjoining lots or lands. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.07 - Positive drainage to be provided; nuisances abated. 
    No condition shall be created nor any existing condition maintained whereby there will be upon any lot or plot excavations, depressions, pits, holes, gullies or similar depressions which may accumulate and retain surface water and which may become a public hazard or nuisance. Any such condition shall be properly abated and protected by filling or by providing positive drainage. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.08 - Drainage protection to adjoining lots. 
    When it is found necessary to grade a lot higher or lower finished grade than the natural grade of adjoining property on the sides and to the rear of such lot, it shall be incumbent upon the owner of the lot to get permission from the Building Department or its Designee to change to a higher or lower finished grade. It shall be further incumbent upon the owner of the lot to provide suitable retaining walls or other approved protection on his property to protect the adjacent property from the drainage of surface and sub-surface waters and further to protect the adjacent property from caving of earth and to assist in the maintaining of the existing natural grade of such adjacent property. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
1351.99 - Penalty. 
(a)  Whoever violates any provisions of this chapter or fails to conform to the grade line set or reviewed by the Building Department or its Designee shall be deemed guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor. 
(b)  Each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense. 
( Ord. No. 17-46 ,  1, 6-19-2017) 
Chapter 1353 - OCCUPANCY ON UNIMPROVED STREETS 

1353.01 - Water, sewer and access road requirements, 
    No person shall begin occupancy for residential purposes of any new building unless and until (a) the water line and sanitary sewer line for the premises have been installed and properly connected to serve the premises, and (b) a street upon which the property abuts has been constructed with a sufficiently stable base to permit access to the premises with City fire trucks and garbage and rubbish trucks. 
(Ord. 57-80, Passed 7-1-57.) 
1353.02 - Standards for compliance. 
    If the street has been surfaced with either cement or asphaltic concrete which meets the specifications for such street surfacing, as set forth in Title Three of the Planning and Zoning Code, such street shall be deemed to comply with the requirements of C.O. 1353.01(b). If the street has not been so surfaced, any person desiring to occupy for residence purposes any building on such unimproved street, shall first make application to the City Engineer for a permit for occupancy, which permit shall be issued if the City Engineer determines that C.O. 1353.01(a) has been complied with and the base of such street is sufficiently stable to meet the requirements of C.O. 1353.01(b). Otherwise such permit shall be denied. 
(Ord. 57-80. Passed 7-1-57.) 
1353.99 - Penalty. 
    Any occupancy of a new dwelling on an unimproved street other than in accordance with this chapter shall be deemed a misdemeanor and the violator shall be fined not less than $5.00 nor more than $50.00. Each day of such occupancy shall be deemed a separate offense. 
(Ord. 57-80. Passed 7-1-57.) 
Chapter 1355 - MOVING BUILDINGS[18] 

Footnotes: 
--- (18) --- 
Cross reference- Building permit required-see BLDG. 1303.01. Protection of sidewalks-see BLDG. Ch. 1341. 

1355.01 - Definitions. 
(a)  For the purposes of this chapter, the following terms, phrases, words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein. When not inconsistent with the context, words in the plural number include the singular number, and words in the singular number include the plural number. The word "shall" is always mandatory and not merely directory. 
(b)  Building means a structure designed, built or occupied as a shelter or other enclosure for persons, animals or property and used for residential, business, mercantile, storage, commercial, industrial, institutional, assembly, educational or recreational purposes, excluding motor vehicles licensed as such by the appropriate governmental authority. Any structure, the outside dimensions of which are all less than ten feet in width, ten feet in length and 14 feet in height (including the moving facility), shall not fall within this definition. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.02 - Permit required. 
    No person shall move any building over, along or across any highway, street or alley, or across private property lines in the City without first obtaining a permit from the Building Commissioner. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.03 - Permit application and fee. 
    A person seeking issuance of a permit hereunder shall file an application for such permit with the Building Commissioner. 
(a)  Form . The application shall be made in writing, upon forms provided by the Building Commissioner, and shall be filed in the office of the Building Commissioner. 
(b)  Contents . The application shall set forth: 
(1)  A description of the building proposed to be moved, giving street number, construction materials, exterior dimensions and height, number of rooms and condition of exterior and interior, and sufficient structural information building, when moved, will comply with the Building Standards; 
(2)  A description of the lot from which the building is to be moved, if located in the City; 
(3)  A description of the lot, if located within the corporate limits of the City, to which it is proposed such building be removed, giving lot, block and tract number; 
(4)  A plot plan showing the proposed location of the building when moved, if the building is to be moved to a location within the corporate limits of the City; 
(5)  The highways, streets and alleys over, along or across which the building is proposed to be moved; 
(6)  Proposed moving date and hours; 
(7)  Photographs of all four elevations of the building; 
(8)  Any additional information which the Building Commissioner shall find necessary to a fair determination of whether a permit should be issued. 
(c)  Accompanying papers . 
(1)  Tax certificate . The owner of the building to be moved, if such building, prior to moving, is located within the City, shall file with the application sufficient evidence that the building and lot from which it is to be removed are free of entanglement and that all current taxes and any City current charges or assessments against the same are paid in full. 
(2)  Certificate of ownership or entitlement . The applicant, if other than the owner, shall file with the application a written statement or bill of sale signed by the owner, or other sufficient evidence that he is entitled to move the building. 
(d)  Fee . The application shall be accompanied by a permit fee in the amount of $1,000.00. 
(Ord. 70-30. Passed 4-6-70; Ord. 13-115. Passed 2-24-14.) 
1355.04 - Deposit for expense to city. 
    Upon receipt of an application, it shall be the duty of the Building Commissioner to estimate the expense that will be incurred in removing and replacing any traffic control signals belonging to the City or any other property of the City, the removal and replacement of which will be required by reason of the moving of the building through the City, together with the cost of the materials necessary to be used in making such removals and replacements. Prior to issuance of the permit the Building Commissioner shall require of the applicant a deposit of a sum of money equal to twice the amount of the estimated expense. 
    Where utility companies supplying services to the City will be affected, the applicant shall file with his application suitable letters of clearance of such utility companies consenting to the removal. It is determined that the following utilities will be affected except when the removal is limited to a relocation on the same or an abutting lot and no portion of any City street will be entered upon: 
Electric (The Illuminating Co.) 
Telephone (Ohio Bell Telephone Co.) 
Gas (The Ohio Fuel Gas Co.) 
Railroads (The N.Y.C. & St. L.R.R. Co., only where moving route crosses tracks). 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.05 - Liability insurance. 
    An application hereunder shall be accompanied by a liability insurance policy, issued by an insurance company authorized to do business in the State of Ohio and approved as to form by the Law Director, in limits for bodily injury or loss of life of $100,000.00 per person; $300,000.00 per accident, and property damage liability of $50,000.00 per accident. Such insurance shall serve as an indemnity for any damage which the City may sustain by reason of damage or injury to any highway, street or alley, sidewalk, fire hydrant, traffic control signals or other property of the City which may be caused by or be incidental to the removal of any building over, along or across any street in the City and to indemnify the City against any claim of damages to persons or private property, and to satisfy any claims by private individuals arising out of, caused by or incidental to the moving of any building over, along or across any street in the City. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.06 - Duties of building commissioner. 
(a)  Inspection . The Building Commissioner shall inspect the building and the applicant's equipment to determine whether the standards for issuance of a permit are met. 
(b)  Standards for issuance . The Building Commissioner shall refuse to issue a permit if he finds: 
(1)  That any application requirement or any fee or deposit requirement has not been complied with; 
(2)  That the building is too large to move without endangering persons or property in the City; 
(3)  That the building is in such a state of deterioration or disrepair or is otherwise so structurally unsafe that it could not be moved without endangering persons and property in the City; 
(4)  That the building is structurally unsafe or unfit for the purpose for which moved, if the removal location is in the City; 
(5)  That the applicant's equipment is unsafe and that persons and property would be endangered by its use; 
(6)  That zoning or other ordinances would be violated by the building in its new location; 
(7)  That for any other reason persons or property in the City would be endangered by the moving of the building. (Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
(c)  Fees and deposits . 
(1)  Deposit . The Building Commissioner shall deposit all fees and deposits, and all bonds or insurance policies with the City Auditor. 
(2)  Return upon nonissuance . Upon his refusal to issue a permit, the Building Commissioner shall return to the applicant all deposits, bonds and insurance policies. Permit fees filed with the application shall not be returned. 
(3)  Return upon allowance for expense . After the building has been removed, the Building Commissioner shall furnish the Auditor with a written statement of all expenses incurred in removing and replacement, together with a statement of all damage caused to, or inflicted upon, property belonging to the City. The Auditor shall authorize the Building Commissioner to return to the applicant all deposits after the City Treasurer deducts the sum sufficient to pay for all damage done to property of the City by reason of the removal of the building. Permit fees deposited with the application shall not be returned. Monies may be retained to satisfy claims of private individuals in accordance with Section 1355.05. 
(d)  Designate streets for removal . The Building Commissioner shall procure from the Department of Public Service and Properties a list of designated streets over which the building may be moved. The Building Commissioner shall have the list approved by the Police Chief and the Fire Chief, and shall reproduce the list upon the permit in writing. In making their determinations, the departments shall act to assure maximum safety to persons and property in the City and to minimize congestion and traffic hazards on public streets. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.07 - Duties of permittee. 
    Every permittee under this chapter shall: 
(a)  Use designated streets . Move a building only over streets designated for such use in the written permit. 
(b)  Notify of revised moving time . Notify the Building Commissioner in writing of any and all changes in moving date and hours as proposed in the application, 48 hours prior to moving. 
(c)  Notify of damage . Notify the Building Commissioner in writing of any and all damage or injury done to property belonging to the City, and any other damage, within 24 hours after the damage or injury has occurred. 
(d)  Display lights . Cause red lights to be displayed during the nighttime on every side of the building while standing on a street, in such manner as to warn the public of the obstruction, and shall at all times erect and maintain barricades across the streets in such manner as directed by the City so as to protect the public from damage or injury by reason of the removal of the building. 
(e)  Street occupancy period . No building shall be left standing on the improved or unimproved portion of any street for more than two hours, unless an extension is granted by both the Police Chief and the Fire Chief. (Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
(f)  Comply with governing law . Comply with the Building Standards, the Fire Code, the Planning and Zoning Code and all other applicable ordinances and laws upon relocating a building in the City. (Ord. 13-116. Passed 2-24-14.) 
(g)  Pay expense of officer . Pay the expense of a traffic officer ordered by the Building Commissioner to accompany the movement of the building, to protect the public from injury. 
(h)  Clear old premises . Remove all rubbish and materials and fill all excavations to existing grade at the original building site, if located within the City, so that the premises are left in a safe and sanitary condition. 
(i)  Remove service connection . See that the sewer lines are plugged with a concrete stopper, the water shut off and the meter returned to the City of Cleveland. The permittee shall notify the gas and electric service companies to remove their services. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.08 - Enforcement. 
(a)  Enforcing officers . The Building Commissioner, the Division of Police, the Department of Public Service and Properties and the Division of Fire shall enforce and carry out the requirements of this chapter. 
(b)  Permittee liable for expense above deposit . The permittee shall be liable for any expense, damages or costs in excess of deposited amounts or securities, and the Law Director shall prosecute an action against the permittee in a court of competent jurisdiction for the recovery of such excessive amounts. 
(c)  Original premises left unsafe . The City shall proceed to do the work necessary to leaving the original premises in a safe and sanitary condition where the permittee does not comply with the requirements of this chapter, and the cost thereof shall be charged against the general deposit. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.09 - Posting of notice. 
    Whenever the building is to be removed to a place within the corporate limits of the City, the posting of notice as required by Section 1303.06 shall be complied with. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.10 - Compliance with zoning. 
    Where appropriate, the provisions of Chapter 1177 of the Planning and Zoning Code shall be complied with in those instances where the type of building being moved falls within the definition of the types of buildings described in such chapter, and such building, when moved, will be located within the corporate limits of the City. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1355.99 - Penalty. 
    Whoever violates any provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction, shall be fined not more than $500.00. 
(Ord. 62-181. Passed 12-17-62.) 
Chapter 1356 - AUTOMOTIVE SERVICE STATIONS 

1356.01 - Definitions. 
    The following definitions shall apply to all sections of this chapter. 
(a)  Inoperative automotive service station means taking an automotive service station out of service for more than three months with the intention of returning the automotive service station to service within 12 months of when service was first discontinued. 
(b)  Abandoned automotive service station means an automotive service station which has failed to operate for at least three consecutive months in any 18-month period. 
(Ord. 02-66. Passed 5-6-02.) 
1356.02 - Abandoned automotive service stations. 
(a)  If any automotive service station becomes abandoned, such automotive service station shall be presumed to be a nuisance affecting or endangering surrounding property values and to be detrimental to the public health, safety, convenience, comfort, property or general welfare of the community and such nuisance shall be abated. 
(b)  Whenever the Building Inspector finds any automotive service station to be abandoned, he shall give notice to the Fire Chief. Notice shall also be given in the same manner as service of summons in civil cases or by certified mail addressed to the owner of record of any premises at his last known address or to the address to which tax bills are sent or by a combination of the foregoing methods, to abate such abandoned condition within 60 days either by placing the station in operation in accordance with these Codified Ordinances, adapting and using the building for another permitted business use or by razing the automotive service station structure. If the structure is used for another permitted use or razed, the pumps, signs and all underground storage tanks shall be removed from the premises in accordance with accepted safe practice as prescribed by Ohio Permanent Rule 1301:7-9-12. 
(c)  Any pavement that must be excavated for the purposes of storage tank removal shall be backfilled with premium fill within two inches of grade, and a two-inch layer of compacted asphalt shall be applied. 
(d)  Upon the failure, neglect or refusal of any owner to comply with the notice to abate such abandonment, the Building Inspector or the Fire Chief shall refer the issue to the Law Department to take such action as may be necessary to abate the nuisance. 
(e)  Inoperative automotive service stations which do not come within the definition of abandoned automotive service station shall be maintained in accordance with the provisions of these Codified Ordinances and the owner shall cut all grass and remove all rubbish and weeds from the premises. The parking of motor vehicles upon such premises shall be prohibited and the owner shall place in the window of such automotive service station a sign of at least ten square feet in area notifying the public of this fact. Notwithstanding any other provision of these Codified Ordinances if the Building Inspector finds that such notice is not complied with by the public, he may order the owner of the premises on which any automotive service station is inoperative for more than six months to install fencing or a barricade approved by the Building Inspector which will be sufficient to block motor vehicle access to the property. 
(Ord. 02-66. Passed 5-6-02.) 
Chapter 1357 - PLUMBING FIXTURES[19] 

Footnotes: 
--- (19) --- 
Cross reference- Registration of contractors-see BLDG. Ch. 1310. Plugging sewer lines when moving building-see BLDG. 1355.07(i). 

1357.01 - Drainage lines to be sealed. 
    Whenever a plumbing fixture is disconnected from its drainage line, the drainage line shall be sealed in such a manner so as to be both airtight and watertight. 
(Ord. 62-185. Passed 12-17-62.) 
1357.99 - Penalty. 
    Whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than $500.00.00. 
(Ord. 62-185. Passed 12-17-62.) 
Chapter 1358 - CONDUCT OF BUSINESS OPERATIONS[20] 

Footnotes: 
--- (20) --- 
Cross reference- Power to regulate building erection-see Ohio R.C. 715.26, 715.29, 737.28, 737.37. Retail businesses-see BUS. REG. Ch. 743. 

1358.01 - Structure compliance with building standards required. 
    No person shall manufacture, fabricate, assemble, sell, store or warehouse any goods, wares, merchandise or products on any land or in structures located within any Business District in the City, except within or from a structure constructed pursuant to and in conformity with the Building Standards adopted by the City. 
(Ord. 64-133. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1358.99 - Penalty. 
    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be fined not more than $500.00 or imprisoned not more than six months or both. 
(Ord. 64-133. Passed 11-2-64.) 
Chapter 1359 - AIR CONDITIONING EQUIPMENT[21] 

Footnotes: 
--- (21) --- 
Cross reference- Registration of contractors-see BLDG. Ch. 1310. 

1359.01 - Installation requirements. 
    All permanent air conditioning equipment, condensers, heat pumps, and heat exchangers, other than those designed for window installation, installed in or in connection with a residential structure, shall be installed entirely within the building structure, or if of a nature and design requiring installation outside the structure, then shall be located so that: 
(a)  No part thereof is closer than ten feet to the nearest lot line of the property in which it is installed; 
(b)  No part thereof (other than wiring and piping) is closer than one foot nor farther than five feet from the structure to be served; and 
(c)  No part thereof shall extend beyond the building setback line as established by the Zoning Ordinance of the City. 
(Ord. 76-38. Passed 3-1-76; Ord. 83-97. Passed 10-3-83.) 
1359.02 - Permit and fee; plan submission. 
    The installation of permanent air conditioning equipment, condensers, heat pumps and heat exchangers, as set forth in Section 1359.01, shall, before installation, require the issuance of a permit from the Building Commissioner, for which a fee shall be charged in accordance with Section 1305.02(d). In each instance, the plans and specifications submitted to the Building Commissioner shall include and set forth, in detail, the equipment proposed to be installed therein or on the premises, and the exact location thereof if any portion is outside the structure. 
(Ord. 79-99. Passed 8-6-79.) 
1359.99 - Penalty. 
    Any person including the owner, occupant, tenant of a residential building in the City or the contractor or other person, who installs. places or allows to remain in a residential building any permanent air conditioning equipment, condenser, heat pump, or heat exchanger in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor. Each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. 76-38. Passed 3-1-76.) 
Chapter 1360 - OIL AND GAS WELLS[22] 

Footnotes: 
--- (22) --- 
Cross reference- State law provisions-see Ohio R.C. Ch. 1509. 

1360.01 - Permit required; fee. 
    No person, firm or corporation shall drill or cause to be drilled a well for gas or oil within the corporate limits of the City, without first obtaining a permit issued by the Building Commissioner, as hereinafter provided, for each well to be drilled. The fee for such permit shall be $500.00. Application for a permit for each well shall be on forms as the Building Commissioner shall prescribe. No such well shall be drilled within any area of the City which is zoned for residential purposes. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.02 - Map required. 
    Every person, firm or corporation, who makes application for a permit to drill a gas or oil well, shall submit a plot plan by a licensed surveyor showing thereon the exact location of the well to be drilled. Such plot plan shall remain on file with the Building Commissioner. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.03 - Investigation; referral to planning commission for recommendation. 
(a)  The Building Commissioner shall refer each application for a permit, together with the plot plan, to the Director of Public Safety, who will cause an investigation to be made of the premises for which such permit is sought. Upon completion of the investigation, the Director of Public Safety shall submit a report of such investigation, together with the application for the permit and the plot plan, to the Planning Commission for its recommendation. The Planning Commission may recommend approval or disapproval of the application depending upon compliance or noncompliance thereon with the provisions of this chapter. 
(b)  The Planning Commission shall have the right to recommend rejection of any application for a permit where, by reason of the location of the proposed well and the character and value of the permanent improvements already erected, and the use of which land and surrounding areas are adapted for civic purposes, or for sanitary reasons, the drilling of an oil or gas well will constitute a serious disadvantage to the City and its inhabitants. When a permit is refused, the deposit of cash required to be made with the application shall be returned to the applicant. Appeal from the denial of a permit shall be to the Board of Zoning Appeals. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.04 - Issuance of permit; bond required. 
    The Building Commissioner shall issue the permit to drill the gas or oil well upon receipt of the application duly approved by the Planning Commission, and upon the applicant furnishing a surety bond in the sum of $200,000.00 approved by the Mayor, conditioned upon the following: 
(a)  Faithful observance of all provisions of law relating to drilling a gas or oil well; 
(b)  That the permittee will restore streets, sidewalks, utilities, public grounds, private grounds, and all other places in the City which may be damaged, to their former condition; 
(c)  The permittee will clear the area of all litter, machinery, derricks, buildings, oil or other substances accumulated in the drilling operation; 
(d)  The permittee will pay any and all damages for property damages or personal injuries arising out of the drilling operation; 
(e)  The permittee will save and hold the City free and harmless from any and all liability arising out of the granting of such permit and operation of the drilling thereunder. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.05 - Duration of bond. 
    The bond as provided for in Section 1360.04 shall be in force and effect during the entire drilling operation and until such time as the well is capped and for 30 days thereafter, at which time the applicant may discontinue the bond if he has complied with all the conditions thereof. In the event the applicant chooses to discontinue his bond as herein provided, he must deposit with the Building Commissioner, in lieu of the $200,000.00 bond, his insurance policies or certificates of insurance covering liability for property damage and for personal injury, and such insurance must be maintained for such period of time as such well is in operation or is producing gas and oil. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.06 - Limitations on permit issuance. 
    No permit shall be issued for the drilling of a well except upon the ground owned by the applicant, or held by the applicant under an oil and gas lease or drilling contract from the owner, giving permission to drill the well. Nothing herein contained, or any permit issued hereunder, shall be deemed to grant any right or license to the permittee to enter upon or occupy, in any respect, for drilling or production operations, any land except by written permission of the owner. 
    When a permit shall have been issued, the same shall terminate and become inoperative without any action on the part of the City, unless within 60 days from the date of issue actual drilling of the well shall have commenced. The cessation of the drilling operation for a like period shall operate to terminate and cancel the permit and the well shall be deemed abandoned for purposes of this chapter. It shall thereafter be unlawful to drill or operate any such well within the corporate limits of the City without the issuance of another permit. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.07 - Location of rig; fire extinguisher required. 
    No person shall erect or use any drilling rig within 300 feet of any building in the City. No person shall drill any gas or oil well within 300 feet of any railroad right-of-way, street or highway as measured from the center of the proposed well to the nearest point of the right-of-way or dedicated portion of the street or highway. 
    Every drilling rig shall be equipped with a fire extinguisher maintained in good condition. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.08 - Permits for certain operations of existing wells. 
(a)  No person, firm or corporation shall clean, repair, extend, deepen or enlarge any existing gas or oil well without first obtaining a permit from the Building Commissioner. Application for such permit shall be made to the Building Commissioner upon such forms as he may prescribe and shall be accompanied by a fee of $50.00. A separate application shall be filed for each well to be cleaned, repaired, extended, deepened or enlarged. 
(b)  No person, firm or corporation shall use, erect or construct any drilling rig within 300 feet of any building for the purpose of cleaning, repairing, extending or deepening any existing gas or oil well, without obtaining written permission from the owners of such building. 
(c)  No person, firm or corporation shall extend, deepen or enlarge any existing gas or oil well within 500 feet of the nearest point of a dedicated portion of any street, or highway or railroad right-of-way. 
    Swabbing, bailing or removing debris is excluded from the necessity of a permit. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.09 - Abandonment and plugging of wells. 
(a)  Permit required . No person, firm or corporation shall abandon or cause to be abandoned a gas or oil well without first obtaining a permit from the Building Commissioner. The fee for such permit shall be $5.00. 
(b)  Procedure to abandon . No person, firm or corporation shall cause a gas or oil well to be abandoned or plugged without first notifying the Building Commissioner of the intent to abandon or plug such well. It is the duty of such person, firm or corporation, after notification, to furnish the Building Commissioner a plot plan by a licensed surveyor indicating thereon the exact location of the well to be abandoned or plugged. Upon compliance with notification requirements and furnishing a plot plan, application for a permit to abandon or plug may be obtained from the Building Commissioner on such forms as he may prescribe. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.10 - Wells required to be plugged. 
    Gas or oil wells, including but not limited to the following, must be plugged: 
(a)  All abandoned wells; 
(b)  All wells under parking lots, in storage or lumber yards and like installations; under streets, roads, highways or rights-of-way; 
(c)  Wells located within 200 feet of the proposed construction of a new building; 
(d)  Wells located within the geographic confines of a new subdivision; 
(e)  Wells located in sewer or water line rights-of-way; 
(f)  Any water wells that are or were used in conjunction with the operation of a gas or oil well. 
    No structures shall in any event be constructed or placed over the top of a well even though such well has been plugged in accordance with the requirements of this chapter. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.11 - Plugging requirements. 
    All abandoned gas or oil wells must be plugged in a manner prescribed by the Division of Mines of the State of Ohio, State statutes and this chapter. 
    In addition to requirements set forth by the State Division of Mines, the following shall be required: 
(a)  All wells to be plugged located under parking lots, roads, streets or highway rights-of-way, or other areas to be used for public purposes, shall be enclosed in a brick or masonry manhole fitted with a steel cover not less than 30 inches in diameter. Such cover shall be plainly marked ABANDONED GAS WELL, and shall be used for access for inspection of the well. 
(b)  All plugged wells must be vented by a vent pipe not less than two inches in diameter and of such height as prescribed by the State Division of Mines, Fire Chief and Building Commissioner. Such vent pipe shall have a drilled and tapped inspection hole. with hole plug not less than one-half inch in diameter not more than four feet above grade. 
(c)  It shall be the duty of any person, firm or corporation, in the drilling of a well or the cleaning of an abandoned well preparatory to the plugging of such abandoned well, to provide for a drilling-in control gate which shall be so constructed as to effectually cut off the flow of gas to the top of the well and which can be operated at a remote point from the well. 
(d)  All abandoned wells to be plugged must be cleaned out to a point approximately 100 feet below the top of the Niagara lime, then bridged solid, and one or more lead plugs set and driven until all gas, oil and water are shut off, then pressure cemented to within 20 feet of the existing eight-inch casing. If the eight-inch casing is not of sufficient quality and quantity, it should be removed and the ten-inch hole reamed to the 200-foot level and a like amount of good grade of eight-inch casing be pressure cemented to the surface to make sure that the vent will be of a more permanent nature. In the event it is a shallow well, it should be treated in the usual manner and filled with prepared fire clay to the surface and vented. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.12 - Discovery of abandoned well. 
(a)  Any person, firm or corporation, being the owner or lessee of land, who discovers an abandoned gas or oil well shall immediately notify the Fire Division and/or the Building Commissioner. 
(b)  Any person, firm or corporation who discovers an abandoned gas or oil well during the development of any land or the construction of any building shall immediately cease all operations until notification is given to the Building Commissioner and such well is treated in accordance with the provisions of this chapter. 
(c)  No person, firm or corporation engaged in any phase of construction shall remove any casing or piping of any abandoned well until such well has been reported to the Building Commissioner and to the representative of the State Division of Mines. No construction shall take place either over or near an abandoned gas or oil well until such well has been inspected and the recommended type of treatment has been made by the Building Commissioner in conformity with the laws of the State and the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.13 - Maintenance of wells. 
    No person, firm or corporation, being the owner of land or lessee of gas or oil well rights upon the land of another, shall permit a gas or oil well to become deteriorated, damaged or in such disrepair to cause leakage of gas or oil. Such leakage of gas or oil shall constitute a nuisance and repair shall be made forthwith. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.14 - Drilling hours. 
    Drilling shall be permitted 24 hours a day, but no driller may dress tools, sharpen bits or operate his forge between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. in any area where there are inhabited dwellings within 1,000 feet of any drilling operations. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.15 - Regulations when chapter inapplicable. 
    Should the provisions of this chapter be unable to be applied, or if applied would be ineffective in carrying out the protection which this chapter is meant to give, then the Building Commissioner, Fire Chief and the State Division of Mines may designate the method to be used. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
1360.99 - Penalty. 
    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than $500.00 or imprisoned not more than six months, or both. 
(Ord. 64-129. Passed 11-2-64.) 
Chapter 1364 - ASPHALT REQUIREMENTS FOR PARKING LOTS AND DRIVEWAYS 

1364.01 - Parking lots-New. 
(a)  All parking lots shall be graded, paved and drained so that no water shall flow over adjacent property; such water shall be conducted to a public sewer. 
(b)  Area shall be graded to provide positive drainage. 
(c)  All vegetation, top soil and unsuitable soils shall be removed. 
(d)  Aggregate base course, of ODOT item 304 shall be spread, leveled, moistened, if needed and power rolled. It shall be at least 6 inches thick and shall be compacted to at least 95 percent of its maximum dry weight. 
(e)  Placing the asphalt shall not be performed during inclement weather. 
(f)  The asphalt intermediate course shall consist of ODOT Item 404 and shall be compacted to a minimum of one and one-half inches. The asphalt surface course shall be ODOT Item 404 and shall be compacted to a minimum of one and one-half inches. All areas inaccessible to the power roller shall be thoroughly tamped with hot iron tampers. The pavement shall have a minimum slope of one percent; no depression will be permitted which will trap water to form a puddle more that one fourth inch deep or more than five feet across. 
(g)  The finished pavement surface will be warped smoothly and evenly to eliminate sharp changes in grade and to avoid ridges and valleys. The resulting pavement shall show a close grained, uniform and smooth surface free of hollows and voids. 
(h)  The seal coat, if applied, shall be applied in accordance with the seal coat materials manufacturer's specifications. 
(i)  Appropriate barriers and signs shall be erected to prevent the movement of traffic over the asphalt pavement until it has set for at least 48 hours. 
(Ord. 06-71. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1364.02 - Parking lots-Resurface. 
(a)  Prior to laying the surface course, the old pavement shall be cleaned. All alligator cracks, upheavals, pot holes and shoving shall be repaired with full depth asphalt paving of ODOT item 404. All contact surfaces and cold pavement joints shall be covered with a liquid asphalt tack coat. 
(b)  Placing the surface course shall not be done during inclement weather. 
(c)  The compacted surface course shall be ODOT item 404 at least two inches thick and shall be compacted by a power roller. All areas inaccessible to the power roller shall be thoroughly tamped with hot iron tampers. 
(d)  The finished pavement surface shall be warped evenly and smoothly to eliminate sharp changes in grade and to avoid ridges and valleys. The pavement shall have a slope of 1 percent and no depressions will be permitted which will trap water to form a puddle more than one fourth inch deep or more than five feet across. The resulting pavement shall show a close grained, uniform and smooth surface free of hollows, voids and unevenness. 
(e)  The seal coat, if applied, shall be applied in accordance with the seal coat materials manufacturer's recommendations. 
(f)  Appropriate barriers and signs will be erected to prevent the movement of traffic over the asphalt pavement until it has set for at least 48 hours. 
(Ord. 06-71. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1364.03 - Driveway-New. 
(a)  All driveways shall be graded, paved and drained so that no water shall flow over adjacent property; such water shall be conducted to a public sewer. 
(b)  Area shall be graded to provide positive drainage. 
(c)  All vegetation, top soil and unsuitable soils shall be removed. 
(d)  Aggregate base course of ODOT Item 304 shall be spread, leveled, moistened, if needed, and power rolled, it shall be at least six inches thick and shall be compacted to at least 95 percent of its maximum dry weight. 
(e)  Placing the asphalt shall not be performed during inclement weather. 
(f)  The asphalt intermediate course shall consist of ODOT Item 404 and shall be compacted to a minimum of one and one-half inches. The asphalt surface course shall be ODOT Item 404 and shall be compacted to a minimum of one and one-half inches. All areas inaccessible to the power roller shall be thoroughly tamped with hot iron tampers. The pavement shall have a minimum slope of 1 percent; no depression will be permitted which will trap water to form a puddle more that one fourth inch deep or more than five feet across. 
(g)  The finished pavement surface will be warped smoothly and evenly to eliminate sharp changes in grade and to avoid ridges and valleys. The resulting pavement shall show a close grained, uniform and smooth surface free of hollows and voids. 
(h)  The seal coat, if applied, shall be applied, according to the seal coat materials manufacturer's specifications. 
(i)  Appropriate barricades and signs shall be erected to prevent the movement of traffic over the pavement until it has set for at least 48 hours. 
(Ord. 06-71. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1364.04 - Driveways-Resurface. 
(a)  Prior to laving the surface course, the old pavement shall be cleaned. All alligator cracks, upheavals, pot holes and shoving shall be repaired with full depth asphalt paving of ODOT item 404. All contact surfaces and cold pavement joints shall be covered with a liquid asphalt tack coat. 
(b)  Placing the surface course shall not be done during inclement weather. 
(c)  The compacted surface course shall be ODOT Item 404 at least two inches thick and shall be compacted by a power roller. All areas inaccessible to the power roller shall be thoroughly tamped with hot iron tampers. 
(d)  The finished pavement surface shall be warped evenly and smoothly to eliminate sharp changes in grade and to avoid ridges and valleys. The pavement shall have a slope of one percent and no depressions will be permitted which will trap water to form a puddle more than one fourth inch deep or more than five feet across. The resulting pavement shall show a close grained, uniform and smooth surface free of hollows, voids and unevenness. 
(e)  The seal coat, if applied, shall be applied in accordance with the seal coat materials manufacturer's recommendations. 
(f)  Appropriate barriers and signs will be erected to prevent the movement of traffic over the asphalt pavement until it has set for at least 48 hours. 
(Ord. 06-71. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1364.99 - Penalty. 
    Any person who shall violate Chapter 1364 shall be seemed guilty of a misdemeanor and fined not exceeding $50.00. Each day's continued violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. 06-71. Passed 10-2-06.) 
Chapter 1365 - RENTAL DWELLING HOUSING LICENSE CODE[23] 

Footnotes: 
--- (23) --- 
Cross reference- Discrimination in housing rental-see GEN.OFF. 515.03. Basic standards for residential occupancy-see BLDG. 1344.04. 

1365.01 - Title. 
    The provisions of this chapter, hereinafter referred to as "this Code" shall be known as "The Bay Village Rental Dwelling Housing License Code." The word "City" in this chapter shall mean the City of Bay Village. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.02 - Purpose. 
    Within the scope of this Code, as hereinafter defined, the purpose of this Code is to establish minimum standards necessary to make all rental dwellings safe, sanitary, free from fire and health hazards and fit for human habitation and beneficial to the public welfare; to establish minimum standards governing the maintenance and repair of rental dwellings and their exterior property areas in such condition so as not to constitute a blighting or deteriorating influence on the neighborhood and the community; to protect property values and maintain the character and appearance of neighborhoods and the community; to attach responsibilities for owners and occupants with respect to sanitation, repair and maintenance; to establish the inspection of rental dwellings; to establish the fee for housing license; to establish enforcement procedures; to authorize the vacation or condemnation of structures unsafe or unfit for human habitation; to fix penalties for failure and/or refusal to abate violations of the Codified Ordinances of the City. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.03 - General scope. 
    The provisions of this Code shall supplement any and all laws of the State of Ohio and City Ordinances and specifically shall include all rules and regulations promulgated by authority of such laws or ordinances applicable to rental dwellings, their exterior property areas and accessory structures. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.04 - Application. 
(a)  This Code shall apply to all rental dwellings, their exterior property area and accessory structures. 
(b)  Existing buildings may continue to be occupied as rental dwellings if: 
(1)  The rental dwelling complies with the provisions of the Codified Ordinances of the City except as to any variance heretofore granted by the Board of Zoning Appeals. 
(2)  The use and occupancy of the rental dwelling is not in violation of any provision of City ordinances and/or applicable statutes of the State of Ohio, including any rules or regulations adopted pursuant to such ordinance or statutes. 
(3)  A housing license as required by this Code has been applied for, issued is current and in effect. 
(c)  The provisions of this code shall apply to all such rental dwellings, their exterior property areas and accessory structures or portions thereof which are in existence or which may come into existence after the effective date of this Code. 
(d)  The Director of the Division of Building, Engineering and Inspections and his authorized agents or representatives are designated to enforce this Code. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.05 - Conflict with other ordinances. 
    In the event of conflict between any provision of this Code, including any rules and regulations adopted pursuant to this Code and any provisions of the Codified Ordinances of the City; that provision or ordinance which establishes the higher standard for the promotion or protection of the health or safety of the occupants shall govern. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.06 - Severability. 
    Sections and subsections of this Code and provisions thereof are hereby declared to be independent sections, subsections and provisions and the holding of any such section, subsection and provision thereof to be unconstitutional, void or ineffective for any cause shall not affect nor render invalid any other section, subsection and provision thereof. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.07 - Definitions. 
    For the purposes of this Code, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning set forth as follows: 
(a)  Dwelling means a building providing complete, independent living facilities for one or more persons, including permanent provisions for living, sleeping, cooking, eating and sanitation. 
(b)  Family means an individual or two or more persons living together as a single housekeeping group in a dwelling. 
(c)  Housing license means an application form provided by the Building Department which authorizes the operation of a rental dwelling. 
(d)  Non-resident means the owner of a rental dwelling, who at the time of application for a housing license, does not reside within Cuyahoga County and/or adjoining counties, i.e.: Lake, Geauga, Portage, Summit, Medina, Lorain or relocates outside these counties after he has been issued a housing license for a rental dwelling, or who for 30 consecutive days or more is located outside the above designated area. 
(e)  Occupant means a family or family member living in a rental dwelling. 
(f)  Owner means a person, corporation and/or company whether incorporated or not, who has legal right of possession, lawful title and/or the deed holder. For purposes of this ordinance an officer of a corporation and/or company can and shall be the owner of record. 
(g)  Rental dwelling means a dwelling occupied by a family where consideration in the form of money or other valuable consideration is paid or exchanged with the legal owner; or occupancy is by a family who is not the legal owner and no money or consideration is paid to the owner. 
(h)  Single housekeeping group means a group of individuals who share expenses and/or labor related to the maintenance of a dwelling and who are living and eating together in a dwelling. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.08 - Housing license. 
    No owner shall let, rent, lease, operate, maintain or occupy any building or portion of any building in which there is one or more rental dwellings unless a housing license as required by this chapter is in force. The housing license shall be signed by the owner as defined in this chapter. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.09 - Housing license fee. 
(a)  A nonrefundable non-prorated housing license fee shall be paid to the City in the amount required by Section 1305.02(k). 
(b)  All housing licenses required by this Code and not secured by the applicable dates as stated in Section 1365.12 shall incur a late fee of $75.00 per rental dwelling for which the housing license is required. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.10 - Housing license issuance. 
    The Building Director shall issue the license applied for if the building and its uses are found to comply in all respects with this Standard and all other laws and ordinances of the City. The housing license shall be posted on the interior at the main entrance of the building for which it is issued. The Building Director may inspect and/or cause to be inspected the building and require compliance in all respects with this Standard and all other laws and ordinances prior to the issuance of the housing license. 
(Ord. 13-117. Passed 2-24-14.) 
1365.11 - Housing license nonresident applicant. 
(a)  A nonresident owner of a rental dwelling shall designate either a janitor, custodian, agent or other responsible person in control for each rental dwelling building and such person shall be a resident of a county as listed in Section 1365.07(d). 
(b)  Such janitor, custodian, agent or other responsible person shall be available during normal business hours to the Building Department and to the occupants of the rental dwelling. A schedule listing the name, address, phone number and available hours of the janitor, custodian, agent or other responsible person shall be posted on the housing license. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.12 - License expiration. 
    Every housing license shall be secured by and expire no later than: 
(a)  All rental dwelling owners shall have secured from the City by April 1 the required housing license. 
(b)  All rental dwelling housing licenses shall expire on March 31 of each year irrespective of the date of issuance. 
(c)  Whenever the ownership of a rental dwelling changes, the current housing license shall become null and void. Housing licenses are not transferable. The new owner shall, within 15 days of title transfer, secure a housing license as required by this Code. 
    For the purpose of this Code, execution of a "land contract agreement" shall not be considered as change of ownership. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.13 - Inspections. 
(a)  The Building Director is hereby authorized to make or cause to be made inspections to determine the condition of rental dwellings in order that he may perform his duty of safeguarding the health and safety of the occupants and of the general public. 
(b)  Inspections may also be made whenever the Building Director has reasonable cause to believe a violation of the Laws and/or Ordinances of the City exist. 
(c)  The Building Director is authorized to revoke a housing license when access is denied to make an inspection. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.14 - Right of entry. 
(a)  For the purpose of making inspections, the Building Director and/or his authorized agent, upon presentation of proper identification, may enter and inspect at all reasonable times the rental dwelling. The owner, responsible person and/or the occupant shall give free access to the rental dwelling for the purpose of inspection. 
(b)  Every occupant of a rental dwelling shall give the owner or his agent free access to the rental dwelling at all reasonable times for the purpose of making repairs and/or improvements that are necessary to comply with the laws and ordinances of the City. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.15 - Pest extermination. 
(a)  Every occupant of a building containing a single rental dwelling shall be responsible for the extermination of any insects, vermin, rodents or other pests therein or on the premises. Exterior yard areas and any accessory structures shall be the responsibility of the dwelling owner to provide pest extermination as required. 
(b)  Every occupant of a building containing two or more rental dwellings shall be responsible for the extermination of any insects, vermin, rodents or other pests within their rental dwelling unit. Common, shared and/or public areas, exterior areas and any accessory structures shall be the responsibility of the building owner to provide pest extermination as required. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.16 - Voiding housing license. 
    Any housing license shall become null and void if: 
(a)  The building for which the license was granted or the use to which it is put are in violation of this code and/or any other applicable ordinance of the City. 
(b)  A false statement or representation was made by the owner in connection with the application and issuance of the housing license. 
(c)  The building for which the license was applied, has rental dwellings added that were not stated on the application and shown on the housing license. 
(Ord. 06-98. Passed 10-2-06.) 
1365.99 - Penalty.
